job_title: Data Processor in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Great coworkers and such a solid company to work for. Had to leave because of relocating but I’d recommend highly as it was the best employer I ever worked for.
cons: No downsides! Can’t think of any negative remarks.

job_title: Counseling in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Health insurance is reasonable priced. Nursing staff on my floors were great.
cons: Management, training, info not provided before hire that you find out after. Residents aren’t treated as they should be for the high cost of living there. CNAs are about 75% unpleasant and uncaring. Upper admin is cliques. A lot of turnover.

job_title: Activities Coordinator in Fort Myers, FL
pros: working with residents was usually great, building relationships
cons: not valued as an employee

job_title: Director in Shell Point Village, FL
pros: Shell Point has a culture of where staff and residents are respected and cared for. Through out its history their mission of caring, serving and satisfying their residents and staff has always been maintained. They have competitive pay and benefit package and opportunities to earn additional bonuses/gifts. Shell Point is very family friendly, understanding the importance of family and their needs. Many employees have family members working at Shell Point. Residents are grateful for the care and service given to them by our employees. It is a very safe place to work and the campuses are beautiful, so lunch along the canal or watching the manatees in the lagoon is a peace filled experienced. Because we are a Christian Community employees feel the love and care from one another. I have been here since 1989 and so is my daughter who is now 31 but started here when she was 15. Shell Point has been very good to us and I would highly recommend anyone to start their career or finish their career here at Shell Point! :)
cons: No place is perfect, but its close

job_title: Call Center Representative in North Fort Myers, FL
pros:

The position is challenging and rewarding.
Truly enjoy assisting residents.
Everyone works together to get things accomplished.
Plenty of training!
cons: Learning curve is tough and ongoing, but training available makes it helps you get through. Have to be able to work independently and enjoy solving problems.

job_title: Finance in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Biggest community in Florida with over 2,000 residents, benefits package better than most others so factor that into your decision, solid culture that looks to promote from within, and top notch leadership team that cares about its people.
cons: Lots of IT projects going on currently as various departments look to catch up with the times. Ask hiring manager for specifics if you don't like change!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Myers, FL
pros: The people at Shell Point are extremely kind. Everyone looks out for you. Management is supportive and approachable and want you to succeed. The Island is a beautiful location. It's like working in paradise. They also continue to make updates to buildings, grounds and technology.
cons: I can't think of any.

job_title: Office Coordinator in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Great environment to learn new things and use those to further personal and professional goals. Company takes the time to create opportunities for the employee to learn and make a difference.
cons: Promotions may come but only if you are lucky enough to be following the person you replace.  Many employees stay for the long term which is great for the company but no so good for those looking to consistently advance.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Good pay,  Great benefits great patients
cons: Staff does not work with you. If you are not liked by some staff members they will do what they can to get rid of you.can be a unkind work environment.

job_title: Production Management in Fort Myers, FL
pros: The pros on this job was everyone was friendly, helpful and very team centered.  It was also a job that encouraged you to lean more so you can do your job better.  They also allowed a certain amount of freedom in how you can do your job, of course within limits.  Every year you got a cash Christmas Bouns that was quite large.
cons: In my job I was required to work odd hours at times and since we had a minimal staff I would work over 40 hours a week often.

job_title: Staff Pharmacist in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Very versatile position with many activities required that keep job interesting , very good support team and management, always a learning experience, with equal amounts of downtime and high speed concentration.  Most employees have been with the company for many years and love it there.
cons: I have no cons to mention- I was let go due to inability to perform duties necessary to perform my job from poor health
